{{Infobox NFL season | logo = | team = Chicago Bears | year = 2008 | record = 9-7 | division_place = 2nd [[NFC North]] | coach = [[Lovie Smith]] | stadium = [[Soldier Field]] | playoffs = ''did not qualify'' | pro bowlers = 1 | uniform = File:NFCN-Uniform-CHI2.PNG }} The '''2008 [[Chicago Bears]] season''' is the franchise's 89th regular season in the [[National Football League]]. They finished the 2008 season with a 9-7 record, improving upon their 7-9 record from the [[2007 Chicago Bears season|2007 season]]. The Bears failed to qualify for the playoffs for the second consecutive season. ==Offseason== ===Offseason transactions=== [[Image:Cedric Benson in 2007.jpg|thumb|right|200px|[[Cedric Benson]], who led the Bears in rushing yards during the 2007 season, was waived from the team following two alcohol-related arrests.]] Following their 7-9 finish in the [[2007 Chicago Bears|2007 season]], the Bears were faced with many issues to address heading into the [[2008 NFL season]]. In an interview, [[Jerry Angelo]], the teamâs [[general manager]], stated the Bears will seek to bring stability to their offense by creating competition for their current [[running backs]] and [[quarterbacks]] through [[free agent|free agency]] and the [[2008 NFL Draft|upcoming draft]].{{cite news | first=Larry | last=Mayer | coauthors= | title=Smith sees QB stability as critical issue with Bears | date=2007-12-31 | publisher= | url =http://www.chicagobears.com/news/NewsStory.asp?story_id=4246 | work =chicagobears.com | pages = | accessdate = 2008-03-05 | language = }}{{cite news | first=Larry | last=Mayer | coauthors= | title=Benson insists competing for top job won't faze him | date=2008-01-08 | publisher= | url =http://www.chicagobears.com/news/NewsStory.asp?story_id=4262 | work =chicagobears.com | pages = | accessdate = 2008-03-05 | language = }} The teamâs running game ranked near last in almost every statistical category, while the Bears had to rely on three different quarterbacks to finish the season. Additionally, the Bears were faced with many questions pertaining to their aging offensive line, which was ridden with injuries and inconsistent play throughout the 2007 season.{{cite news | first=Vinnie | last=Lyer | coauthors= | title= Bears need to show Faneca love, money | date=2008-02-14 | publisher=[[Yahoo! A few days later, Jerry Angelo stated the franchise would not re-sign [[Ruben Brown]], and suggested the team was in the process of rebuilding their offensive line.{{cite news | first=Larry | last=Mayer | coauthors= | title=Mike Brown in, Ruben Brown out of Bears' '08 plans | date=2008-02-21 | publisher= | url =http://www.chicagobears.com/news/NewsStory.asp?story_id=4392 | work =chicagobears.com | pages = | accessdate = 2008-03-05 | language = }} The Bears then focused their attention to their quarterbacks; re-signing [[Rex Grossman]],{{cite news | first=Dennis | last=Dillon | coauthors= | title=Re-signing Grossman doesn't improve Bears | date=2008-02-25 | publisher=Sporting News | url =http://www.sportingnews.com/yourturn/viewtopic.php?t=360634 | work =sportingnews.com | pages = | accessdate = 2008-03-05 | language = }} and extending [[Kyle Orton]]âs contract for another year.{{cite news | first=Vaughn | last=McClure | coauthors= | title=Bears QB Kyle Orton happy to stay | date=2008-02-27 | publisher=[[Chicago Tribune]] | url =http://www.chicagotribune.com/sports/chi-27-bears-kyle-ortonfeb27,1,1839835.story | work =chicagotribune.com | pages = | accessdate = 2008-03-05 | language = }} The team considered releasing [[Brian Griese]] in order to avoid a $300,000 [[USD|dollar]] bonus, but eventually traded him to the [[Tampa Bay Buccaneers]] for a sixth round draft pick in the 2009 NFL Draft.{{cite news | first=Larry | last=Mayer | coauthors= | title=Bears trade Griese to Tampa Bay for pick in '09 draft | date=2008-03-03 | publisher= | url =http://www.chicagobears.com/news/NewsStory.asp?story_id=4433 | work =chicagobears.com | pages = | accessdate = 2008-03-05 | language = }} Finally, the Bears were left to deal with their top three free agents, [[Brendon Ayanbadejo]], [[Bernard Berrian]], and [[Lance Briggs]].{{cite news | first=Charles | last=Robinson | coauthors= | title=Unbearable market could doom Chicago | date=2008-02-28 | publisher=[[Yahoo!
